He wrote thus of the universities: "I am much afraid that the universities will prove to be the great gates of hell, 
                                                                           141
unless they diligently labor in explaining the Holy Scriptures, and engraving them in the hearts of youth. I advise no one to place his child where the Scriptures do not reign paramount. Every institution in which men are not unceasingly occupied with the word of God must become corrupt."-- Ibid., b. 6, ch. 3.
